name: Michele Caselle
title: Professor
description: Interested in Statistical Mechanics and Quantum Field Theory, with a side of Quantitative Biology

name: Matteo Osella
title: Associate professor
description: I lead our projects in machine learning and systems biology, but my true passion are scaling laws

name: Filippo Valle
title: Postdoc
description: Curious about the complexity behind the systems, I love coding and data mining

name: Letizia Pizzini
title: PhD Student
description: My main interest lies in quantitative analysis of biological Systems, focusing on multiomics data integration, EEG and brain image data interpretation

name: Davide Pirovano
title: PhD Student
description: Have you ever asked yourself if becoming a bird-watching champion would help you to distinguish a parrot from a go-kart? Well, it turns out that sometimes it can be useful when training Neural Networks. My PhD research essentially focuses on that “sometimes”

name: Federico Milanesio
title: PhD Student
description: I mostly study neural networks dynamics and optimal transport, but I have a whole theory on the statistical mechanics of foosball Elos I can't wait to tell you about

name: Leonardo Agasso
title: PhD Student
description: My main interests are systems biology and bioinformatics, I'm currently studying  the role of non-coding RNAs and gene duplication in shaping the vertebrate regulatory network
